pros: Great benefits excellent work life balance tuition
cons: pay is low No room for advancement

pros: The students are wonderful and are the reason I stayed as long as I did.
cons: There is zero management experience among managing staff. The place is a joke.

job_title: Student Help Desk Employee in Manchester, NH
pros: Not too much work, can work on homework most of the time
cons: No growth opportunities at all.

review_title: Lies, Deceit, Cover Ups for “Smoking Mirror” image
job_title: Housekeeping / Custodial Worker in Manchester, NH
pros: Student’s appreciate your work much more than Management.
cons: Scare tactic’s used all day, everyday. Get ready to be left with sewage back ups from sinks, floor drains and toilets with mold growing rapidly in most dorms. Don’t bother becoming a “whistle blower” as Physical Plant management does not want to hear it. Appears they have no clue how to properly and safely repair issues. They like easy fix. Put a blind aid on it, over and over, year after year.

pros: Wonderful community with a tremendous mission.
cons: None to share at this time

pros: On campus, flexible schedule, easy job
cons: Sometimes stressful and people are angry at you all the time

review_title: Small School --to its credit and limitations
pros: Small community, familial ethos, thoughtful about workload balance, responsive administration. Wonderful colleagues.
cons: Salary seems low to the market. Tuition-dependent

pros:
The staff members where mostly pleasant and helpful
willing to accommodate you if needed!
cons: The job description was not what the job was

pros: Great community feel, friendly, good time off
cons: Low pay, little to no raises or bonuses, overworked

pros: A nice place with motivated students.
cons: They think they are more important than they are.

review_title: Great place to work if you want NO stress!
pros: Very nice atmosphere - no stress, great people, flexible schedule, short Fridays in the summer, Christmas break (paid), benefit of College education for me and children is a HUGE perk! The people are very nice.
cons: Slower pace than I'm used to, so tendency to get boring at times. No AC in a lot of the buildings. Lower pay, but benefits tend to make up for it, especially free college education for my kids.

pros: The people are awesome - that atmosphere is wonderful. The campus is beautiful during any season. You can't beat the no stress environment. And you get free tuition for you and your children! Access to fitness center (free), short Fridays during the summer and a week off after Christmas - awesome perks!
cons: You won't get rich working here unless you're a Director or VP.

pros: Super nice people, awesome environment, great benefits, great perks - LOVE my boss! One week off for the Christmas break, leave early on Fridays during the summer, and very flexible schedule; low keyed, low stress most days. Great work/life balance.
cons: No AC throughout the building - can be killer in the summer time.

review_title: Pretty much what one would expect of a Catholic college.
pros: Campus is beautiful, people are friendly, invested community, Jedi walk the campus (monks - but still fun to think about!)
cons: Acceptance rate is high - many students not engaged in academics - more focused on social life.  Many students resort to drinking as the only means of entertainment.

pros: The college has a great work environment
cons: The salaries are to low to be competitive for experienced employees

review_title: Needs better upper management in administration
pros: Great people; nice environment; students are caring.
cons: Tough to introduce new ideas; lots of inter- and intra-office disconnect; lack of support from administration.

pros:
Friendly place to work
Support from other departments once you get to know them
President is extremely supportive
cons: Lot of unknowns due to money issues with school

pros: Great opportunity for current students. Every job there knows you're a student first, employee second. Works well for athletes too.
cons: Things can become very slow on campus.

pros: Very good company to work for
cons: Not a lot of professional advancement opportunities

pros: Sense of community, nice campus, great co-workers
cons: Salaries and benefits could be better
